translated: Those wise ones, a hundred thousand,
with the six deep knowledges and great powers;
I was on the back of an elephant,
Getting down from the elephant’s back,
I approached the bull among men;
I held up a jewel parasol
will dwell in the Tusita heaven;

analyzed: catuttisati khattum ca  deva rajjam karissati
translated: Thirty-four times,🔽he will reign as king of the gods;
Thirty-four times a king of the gods,
and eight hundred times a lord of the earth,🔽a universal monarch,
he will rule over the earth.
Fifty-eight times a king of the gods,🔽and fifty-eight times a lord of the earth,🔽a universal monarch,
he will rule over the earth.

analyzed: okkāka kula sambhavaḥ  gotamaḥ nāma gottena
translated: born in the family of the crows,

analyzed: satthā loke bhavissati  sakyānam kula ketuḥ sa
translated: he will be a teacher in the world,🔽known as Gotama by clan.
He will be a relative of the Sakyans,🔽a kinsman of the great sage,
the attendant of the great sage.🔽He will be ardent and discerning,
He will be devoted to striving,
Having fully understood all the pollutants,
he will be extinguished, without pollutants.
with tusks like spears, and huge.
There are many hundreds of thousands
But they are not equal to the Buddha, the elephant of men,
then the middle, and then the last;
With a clear mind and a happy heart,
I attended on the best of Buddhas.
I attained the fruit of stream-entry,
skilled in the stages of training.
For a hundred thousand aeons,🔽the deed I performed
I have now reached that stage,
standing firm in the true Dhamma.
How welcome it was for me
in the presence of the best of Buddhas;
The three knowledges have been attained,
the Buddha’s instruction has been fulfilled.
and the eight liberations as well;
The six supernormal knowledges have been realized,
the Buddha’s instruction has been fulfilled.”🔽Thus has the elder Ānanda recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā ānando thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Ānandattherassāpadānaṁ dasamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmai ānandaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati  ānanda therassa apadānam dasama
translated: The elder Ānanda’s chapter is the tenth.
In the Apadāna, the first chapter is the Chapter on the Buddha.
